Package ohos.agp.render

Class SweepShader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.render.Shader
      • ohos.agp.render.SweepShader

  • public class SweepShader
extends Shader
    Represents a shader that shades colors in sweep manner around a center point.

    This class inherits from Shader. You can use the methods in this class to configure the position of each color.

    Since:
    3

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class ohos.agp.render.Shader

    • Field Detail

      • positions

        public float[] positions
        Stores the positions of all colors in the Shader#shaderColors array.

        Color positions values monotonically increase from 0 to 1.0. If the values do not increase monotonically, the drawing result may be unexpected. If the positions parameter is null, the colors will be evenly shaded.

        Since:
        3

      • xCoordinate

        public float xCoordinate
        Indicates the X-axis coordinate of the center point of the SweepShader.
        Since:
        3

      • yCoordinate

        public float yCoordinate
        Indicates the Y-axis coordinate of the center point of the SweepShader.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SweepShader

        public SweepShader​()
        Default constructor used to create a SweepShader.

        Calling this constructor will automatically invoke SweepShader#SweepShader(float,float,Color[],float[]) to create a sweep shader.

        Since:
        3

      • SweepShader

        public SweepShader​(float xCoor,
                   float yCoor,
                   Color[] newColors,
                   float[] newPositions)
        A constructor used to create a SweepShader based on the specified center point, colors, and color positions.
        Parameters:
        xCoor - Indicates the X-axis coordinate of the center point.
        yCoor - Indicates the Y-axis coordinate of the center point.
        newColors - Indicates the array of sweep shading colors.
        newPositions - Indicates the positions of all colors in newColors. This parameter can be null.
        Since:
        3
